name: Montien Hotel Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 4 day stay at Montien was originally a second choice purely on recommendation from our travel agent because there were no rooms available at our first option, but retrospectively it turned out to be a great stay.
reviews.title: Bang on in Bangkok

likes.liked: — Proximity to Patpong Rd and night markets, accessibility to train stations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our check in was efficient, and the service and reception we received from staff for our entire stay was superb. We had smiles, prompt service and willingness to please from everyone from the check-in/reception staff through to the restaurant staff, cleaners and information staff. Even the doormen were lovely.
reviews.title: Superb

likes.disliked: — Internet was expensive at 214 baht per hour

reviews.title: Loved the Montien
reviews.text: We arrived in Bangkok at night, so our first impression was that of the Montien's great location, which is directly across the road from the Patpong night markets and bars. We made the most of this and really enjoyed our proximity to the vibrancy and "entertainment" of the area - particularly loving our nightly drinks at the pleasant Cafe Kaldi on the corner, where we would people watch for hours.

reviews.title: love the Montien and the fabulous fifties Lobby music
reviews.text: The Montien's decor is heading towards a looking a little dated, but this was more than outweighed by its cleanliness and the fact that our room was extremely comfortable and quiet. Our bed was enormous and very comfortable too. The bathroom was rather small and prone to steaminess - not conducive to quick clothes drying if you're doing your own laundry.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The included breakfast was a revelation, huge and varied and well cooked, with smiling, conscientious service - and out of the 5 hotels we stayed at during our time in Thailand it was only matched by one other. We didn't eat in the restaurant at nighttime, preferring to make the most of the street vendors and numerous eateries just at the hotel's doorstep.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended
Older style Hotel, nice but the area is an eye opener!
reviews.text: A older style hotel near to Patpong, for those of you that are used to modern style hotels this is completely different, plenty of wooden panelling, gold and mirrors etc. The hotel itself is very nice rooms,are comfortable and have all the facilities you would expect for a hotel of this standard. Staff were very friendly and could not do enough to help. The hotel has a nice pool a few levels up which is nice for relaxing and cooling off. We did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on the restaurants but there are a couple of them on site and the menu's looked pretty good.

reviews.title: Lovely stay at the Montien
reviews.text: The location of the hotel; a lively area (although the hotel has a seperate road off the main street with security barriers) and is very close to the streets of Patpong which traditionally has many of the sleazier clubs and bars associated with Bangkok. Dont let this put you off though, its confined to a couple of streets and actually quite amusing to see it.

reviews.title: Very Disappointing
reviews.text: Restaurants of all standards and bars to cater for all tastes within walking distance of the hotel.

reviews.title: The Good Wing & The Bad Wing
reviews.text: Transport: 10m mins walk to the skytrain or metro, cabs readily availible and tut tuts everywhere!

reviews.title: Stay over the New Year Period
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Montien for 8 nights in February 08.

reviews.title: great place to stay
reviews.text: This was our 2nd trip to Bangkok to do some shopping, our first trip we went with a group, this trip was just my daughter and myself on a stop over from Ireland. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, the service, rooms, cocktails, food (especially the breakfast buffet) and staff are amazing. We loved the night markets right across the road - means you can go shopping when its cooler, then wander back to the hotel for a swim! just magic

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: Tip one: leave at least 1 hour to simply sit and enjoy the best international buffet breakfast, before starting your day of adventure

reviews.title: Excellent for a few nights stay
reviews.text: Tip two: start your shopping on dusk at Patpong Markets right across the road, as the first sale gets the best deals, makes for a better profit for the stall holders!

reviews.title: I agree, the old wing is looking very tired!
reviews.text: Tip three: once finished shopping enjoy an icy cold cocktail back at the hotel

reviews.title: exellent hotel fab location
reviews.text: Tip four: enjoy a swim in the pool to top the night off

Stayed at this hotel with my family in January. The hotel was nice: friendy staff and comfortable rooms. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The pool is very small, and there are only a few sunbeds. But you probably have other things to do in Bangkok, than just lie in the sun.
reviews.title: Montien Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated right in front of the Patpong nightmarket, but if you like to go shopping, go to Siam square by skytrain or take a tuk-tuk or a taxi to Suan Lum night bazaar, because it's expensive at Patpong nightmarket.
reviews.title: perfect location, EXCELLENT staff, ageing elegange

likes.liked: — an excellent service offered by all staff throughout the hotel, very good food, perfect location
likes.disliked: — some signs of age especially in bathroom, fabric artificial flowers instead of real ones throughout the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm luckily back at the Montien, after one short test-stay last year, after having been customer of the Sofitel Silom for years. It was a good choice indeed! The property is perfectly located just outside the bustle of Patpong Area, 5 mins. walk to Silom Rd and to Subway and Skytrain. Being the hotel founded in 1967, it obviously shows some signs of age, bathrooms to be renovated, here and there some decoration to be modernized: however everything is more than compensated by the excellent staff, perfectly trained, polite, warm but not pushy, worth a 5 stars hotel. Extremely recommended also the Ruenton Coffee shop, with a wonderful top quality thai+western buffet, committed waiters. Small but very nice the Bakery Shop which offers 50% discounts after 6PM on good snacks and cakes. Pool -which seemed to me renovated since last year- is not large but adequate. Absolutely recommended unless -as I wrote in my previous comment- you're a contemporary minimal chic addicted. Remember: forget some signs of age of bathrooms and corridors and cherish the service offered. It's the staff who make a hotel's reputation, and at the Montien they all work so well from doorman to bellboys, receptionists, cashiers, waiters, maitre d' and so on that you really feel perfectly at the right place.
reviews.title: Good location, not too busy.

likes.liked: — It was in an interesting location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a good experience at Montien. We arrived very early in the morning after an 8 and half hour flight. The travel agent had requested early check in but I didn't hold out much hope to get our room that early in the morning but we only had to wait until about 9 before we could access our room. Last year when we arrived that early at a hotel I paid for an extra nights accommodation so we could have a rest so we did appreciate not having to pay for the priviledge. The room was spacoius and comfortable with a nice bathroom. Everything worked well and we had a good view out of the front of the hotel. It is in a part of Bangkok which is not as hectic as some as it seems to be an area with lots of office workers. It is opposite a street which has the red light district with lots of girly bars and boy bars down the side streets but even though we wandered around the night market in the street there was nothing offensive. We were more concerned about how youung the girls in their white bikinis were that were out the front of the bars. There was a muck up with the hotel reception thinking that breakfast wasn't included in our deal and I couldn't prove that it was. We were told to have breakfast and keep our receipt and it would be refunded if need be but we went for a walk instead and found a McDonalds. When we got back we were called over and told that it was included as they had emailed the travel agent to check. It was our fault we didn't do as we were told. We were leaving early the next morning so didn't have much time to enjoy the buffet breakfast but everything we had was great. There were plenty of small places out in the streets to have meals rather than the more expensive places in the hotel and lots of street stalls if you are adventurous enough. The night market was not as good as the bigger ones in other parts of the city. The variety was not good and the prices comparitively high. Best to shop near The Indra Regent and Baiyoke Sky. It was a good hotel and a nice place to stay if you don't like crowds. The pool was clean and plenty of sun lounges with a bar handy for drinks.

description: Welcome to The Montien Hotel BangkokIn Bangkok for shopping, entertainment or business, The Montien Hotel Bangkok is the ideal place to stay. Conveniently located only minutes away from sky train station Saladaeng on Silom, the underground station Sam Yan on Rama IV and Hua Lumpong main railway station. The Montien Hotel Bangkok offers all modern amenities, including high speed internet access and non-smoking rooms, complimented by traditional Thai hospitality.The Montien Hotel Bangkok is in easy reach of major shopping centers such as Siam Paragon, Central World Plaza, MBK, and Gaysorn, as well as tourist attractions like China Town, The Grand Palace and The River of King, the Chao Praya river and Lumpini Park.
